Title: RFT for the Provision of Electrical Services Framework at MEDITE Europe DAC ‘25
Description: Medite Europe DAC are seeking tender submissions from suitably qualified electrical companies with extensive experience in the MDF / wood processing industry for appointment to a Framework Agreement for a range of small to medium sized Mechanical works at their plant in Redmondstown, Clonmel, Co. Tipperary, E91 V584. Types of works: 1) Annual Large-scale shutdown works 2) Fortnightly shutdown works 3) Hourly rate works related to projects An example of the type of work involved is listed but not limited to the table below No. Electrical Activity Performance Characteristics 1. Visual Inspections Inspection should look for: Evidence of damage caused by dirt, loose parts, or foreign objects. Verification that air inlets are not blocked. Evidence of moisture and/or dirt build-up Unusual noises, leaking oil seals, or high vibration. Oil level gages (if present) should be checked. Evidence of degradation of foundation, bed plates, anchor bolts Evidence of oil rings turning (if applicable) Evidence of leaking oil and water piping and connections 2. Temperature monitoring of bearings and windings If motor is not equipped with installed sensors: record bearing temperatures and stator temperature using thermo graphic imaging. This data should be trended. The monitoring should be completed at similar motor loading and ambient temperature to allow for accurate trending. 3. Vibration Record and trend vibration levels. This should be done by a trained and experienced technician, preferably a qualified level II technician. 4. Oil Analysis Sample and analyse. Look at overall conditions and check for foreign matter, additive depletion, varnish precursors and metallic elements. 5. Running Current Record and trend all three phase currents and verify the currents are balanced and do not exceed nameplate rating. Each phase should be within +/- 5per cent of the average of all three phases 6. Cabling / Re-wiring Pulling cabling in to place and wiring according to specification outlined. 7. Insulation resistance (IR) Perform IR check between motor leads and ground. This determines condition of the ground insulation. Record, temperature correct and trend Motor Test Acceptable voltage voltage(Vdc) reading 8. Winding Resistance A comparison of the line-to-line resistances of the motor’s winding. This test should be done at the motor terminals using a meter capable of measuring low resistance (milliohms). A typical ohm meter does not have adequate accuracy. Record, temperate correct and trend. Each phase should be within +/- (3 - 5 per cent) of the average of all three phases 9. Bearing Insulation Resistance Check (if applicable) Completed similar to other IR (megger) test. Used to verify condition of insulation on a bearing. Test voltage: 500 Vdc Acceptance criteria: 1 megohm 10. Shaft Total Indicated Run Out (TIR) Measure the trueness of the shaft extension. A high value can cause vibration issues. Acceptance criteria: 3600 rpm max .001 in Please see attached tender doc for full scope of works

Title: Supply of PPE and Corporate Clothing
Description: Tai Tarian is seeking to issue a Contract for the supply of Tai Tarian’s PPE and Corporate Clothing This tender will be split into the following two Lots:Lot 1 – Supply of PPELot 2 – Supply of Corporate ClothingLots will be awarded on an individual basis, and a Tenderer can bid for either one or both Lots.Therefore, Tenderers must ensure that their submission clearly shows that they’re able to meet the requirements of each selected Lot, and not to make any statement or assumption that their bid is conditional on being awarded all, or a minimum number of Lots.Tenderers must be aware that in regards of Lot 1, requirements will include but not be limited to the following: -•An OTIF (On-Time In-Full) delivery of all goods from the Pricing Schedule within 24 hours for core products.•A delivery service direct to Tai Tarian’s head office and satellite depots for additional items. •A local same day collection service for all goods, as and when required from a recommended and agreed “solution” giving the availability to collect within 1 hour.•A local collection and/or delivery service of additional ad hoc products throughout the contract period that are not listed in the core list Pricing Schedule.•A detailed and accurate “live” reporting function, which will include but not be limited to historic purchases per employee.•PPE must comply with the relevant EN standards. •All PPE must carry UKCA or CE markings, in accordance with the PPE Regulations 2018.•Suppliers must provide Declarations of Conformity and access to technical documentation upon request.•Items stated in the Price Schedule must be priced on a like for like basis – no alternatives will be accepted at this stage.•Annual servicing of Jetstream power respirators.•Jetstream breakdown/repair/replacements would need to be completed at short notice, with the Initial survey being completed within 24 hours.Tenderers must be aware that in regards of Lot 2, requirements will include but not be limited to the following: -•An OTIF (On-Tim-In-Full) delivery of all goods from the Pricing Schedule within 4 days from order.•A delivery service direct to Tai Tarian’s head office and satellite depots for additional items if required.•A local same day collection service for all goods, as and when required from a recommended and agreed “solution” giving the availability to collect within 1 hour.•The ability to return un-used and un-worn items within 28 days without a re-stocking charge•A local collection and/or delivery service of additional ad hoc products throughout the contract period that are not listed in the core list Pricing Schedule.•A detailed and accurate “live” reporting function, which will include but not be limited to historic purchases per employee.•Items stated in the Price Schedule must be priced on a like for like basis – no alternatives will be accepted at this stage.Tenderers must be aware that all quantities provided in the Price Schedule are estimated based on current annual quantities and used for tender purposes only. The quantities and scope of requirements may change throughout the life of the Contract. Form of ContractThe Form of Contract utilised for this Contract will be Tai Tarian’s Terms and Conditions for the Supply of Goods and Related Services. Price Increase MechanismPrices submitted in Appendix 2 - Price Schedule are to be fixed for the first 12 months of the Contract until 1st February 2027 for each Lot.  Subsequent price increases will then be agreed on an annual basis. Any increases shall not exceed the latest published monthly percentage change in the Consumer Prices Index (CPI) at the time of the annual price increase review.Valuation and PaymentA Supplier will submit invoices for payment and payment of undisputed invoices will be made within 30 days.

Title: Two Year Contract for Boiler Replacement Works
Description: The Contract primarily involves the replacement and installation of new condensing combination boilers, controls and flues throughout Glasgow. The Contract may also include a small number of properties that require replacement of ‘heat only’ boilers including replacement of the existing boiler and hot water cylinder. The property address list issued with the tender documentation is based upon Southside Housing Association’s aim to undertake boiler replacement works to all 144no properties listed within Tender Document 6 during Financial Years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027. Southside Housing Association are endeavouring to undertake 72no boiler replacements during financial year 2025-2026 and a further 72no boiler replacements during financial year 2026-2027, and the contract will initially relate to works to be completed during financial years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027. Subject to successful completion of the two-year programme of surveys and works, the Contract may be extended by a maximum period of three further years through 1 + 1 + 1 twelve-month extensions from the completion date. However, the actual number of boiler replacement works that can be undertaken during each financial year can only be confirmed by Southside Housing Association to the successful tenderer once this procurement has been completed as the actual number of boiler replacements that Southside Housing Association can undertake relative to their budget will be determined by the tender prices submitted by the highest scoring tenderer. The boiler replacement works during the initial two years of the contract are anticipated to involve; - Replacement of Condensing Combination boilers to approximately 137no existing properties with new boilers, controls, pipework enclosures, modifying boiler housing units, chemical flushing of existing systems, filling systems with inhibitor, installing new magnetic dirt collector, fitting new carbon monoxide alarms, electrical works and providing new EPC’s for the properties; and - Replacement of ‘heat only’ boilers and hot water cylinders to approximately 7no existing properties with new boilers, hot water cylinders, controls, pipework enclosures, modifying boiler housing units, chemical flushing of existing systems, filling systems with inhibitor, installing new magnetic dirt collector, fitting new carbon monoxide alarms, electrical works and providing new EPC’s for the properties. The scope of works may also include, as required, replacement of existing radiators, TRV’s, wall cores for new boiler flues, condensate pumps, soakaways and asbestos surveys.Lot 1: Single stage tendering and all bidders may submit a tender.. Economic operators may be excluded from this competition if they are in any of the situations referred to in regulation 8 and 9 of the Procurement (Scotland) Regulations 2016. SPD Question 2D.1.2- Bidders must provide a separate SPD response (Sections A and B of this Part and Part III) for each subcontractor

Title: DBS Security Operations Centre (SOC) Service
Description: DBS is progressing a major transformation of its legacy IT estate, moving to modern, Software-as-a-Service (SaaS)–based applications.As part of this transformation, DBS intends to procure a modern, CREST accredited Security Operations Centre (SOC) Service to protect and monitor its next-generation estate.The SOC will be implemented on the next generation estate only, there is no requirement for SOC services on the legacy estate which is mainly greenfield and as such there is no history of security logs, events or incidents for the applications in scope.It will include multiple SaaS-based services, a data integration platform, connection to third-party services (which may provide log feeds), and potentially other IaaS/PaaS cloud based services, for which the service shall be capable of onboarding and monitoring.Multiple third parties work with the Buyer to deliver technology and business services and have access to the Buyer's information and systems. End point, network and other supporting services (email and productivity tools for example) are provided to the Buyer and monitored by the Home Office and as such are out of scope of the SOC Service;DBS holds information that is highly sensitive and must not be subject to compromise.  It depends on real-time, accurate transactions, any compromise to the integrity of such data could lead to significant losses;DBS collects, stores and manages Personal Data (including sensitive Personal Data); andDBS services provide evidence to legal bodies that require full audit and visibility of data creation, manipulation and access as part of legislative and regulatory requirements.DBS require a supplier to design, build and maintain the SOC that is compliant with / aligned to the NCSC guide on building a SOC encompassing: the operating model; onboarding; detection; threat intelligence; and Security Incident response and management.The SOC must be available and operate 24 hours a day, 7 days a week (at all times).  More information about DBS and its operations can be found at: Disclosure and Barring Service - GOV.UK (www.gov.uk).

Title: Pontarddulais Comprehensive School ~ Cleaning Tender
Description: The successful supplier will be required to provide cleaning services for Pontarddulais Comprehensive School, located in Swansea, Wales.   The value of the contract is approximately £140,000 per annum. Pontarddulais Comprehensive School is an English medium 11-16 mixed school in the City and County of Swansea. There are currently 850 pupils on roll. The School was opened in 1982, with a Specialist Teaching Facility added in 2007 for up to 10 pupils with profound and multiple learning disabilities. It serves a large catchment area that includes Llangyfelach, Pengelli, Pontarddulais, Pontlliw and Penllergaer primary schools. Pupils are drawn from a widely dispersed catchment area including urban areas, small villages and hill farms. A significant demand for places outside the designated catchment confirms the popularity of the school.The School has sustained a record of excellent performance in pupil outcomes over several years. The School received a hugely positive Estyn inspection in December 2023. It was noted that "Pontarddulais Comprehensive School is a dynamic and inclusive school where pupils, regardless of background or ability, thrive academically, socially, and emotionally”.The school places great value on their partnerships with parents and carers. They believe that pupils’ success is founded on forging positive relationships through mutual respect, and excellent teaching and learning experiences.The motto for the school is "Learn to live, Live to learn". This reflects the school's philosophy of nurturing successful learners who have a lifelong love of learning and grow into confident, resilient, and caring individuals.The school prides itself on its team ethos and would see the cleaning contractor as part of the wider team. They are community focussed and take time to forge relationships between staff and pupils and those teams they work with. They would want the cleaning contractor to forge relationships with staff and take pride in the building itself.The fabric of the building is the same as it was when it opened in 1982 so it is tired in appearance and can cause a challenge to keep looking up to standard. There is a Specialist Teaching Facility as part of the school site with pupils who have profound and multiple learning difficulties. This unit in particular, requires a high level of cleaning due to pupils higher risk of infection.The school is a busy and thriving environment that will require cleaning contractors to be flexible to fit around events that take place in the building.The duration of the contract being offered is three years commencing on 1st April 2026 and concluding on 31st March 2029 and will be on a guaranteed performance basis offering a fixed annual subsidy to the school. There will be the option to extend the contract for a further term further term of three years.   Please see PSQ Document for more informationFor more information about this opportunity, please visit the Delta eSourcing portal at: https://litmustms.co.uk/tenders/UK-UK-Swansea:-School-cleaning-services./K5ET5MH534To respond to this opportunity, please click here: https://litmustms.co.uk/respond/K5ET5MH534

Title: Commissioning Homes for Children Looked After & Care Leavers PDPS - Lot 4 Rd 5
Description: The London Borough of Newham wishes to establish a Pseudo-Dynamic Purchasing System (PDPS) for the supply of services in respect of children's externally commissioned care, accommodation and support services. The services include:Lot 1: Provision of Semi-Independent Living Services - already establishedLot 2: Provision of Children's Homes regulated by Ofsted - already establishedLot 3: Provision of Supported LodgingsLot 4: Provision of Independent Fostering Agencies (IFA) regulated by OfstedThese services will be available to looked after children, care leavers and young people who are homeless or at risk of homelessness .Potential Suppliers are invited to Tender for one or more of the Lots.This PDPS is open for use to the following (and subject to Section 3 Scope of Agreement of LAC PDPS Agreement Processor):• any Public Body outlined in either Part I or Part II of the Local Authorities (Goods and Services) (Public Bodies) Order 1972. Details of these can be found at http://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/1972/853/madeThe Procurement is being procured by the Authority for the benefit of the Authority and the Partner Organisations.The procurement is being conducted in accordance with the Public Contracts Regulations 2015. The procurement is subject to the light-touch regime under Section 7 Social and Other Specific Services. Under Regulation 76 the Council is free to establish a procedure, provided that procedure is sufficient to ensure compliance with the principles of transparency and equal treatment of economic operators (Suppliers).The Authority has created a tender process outlined below, as part of the PDPS applying the award criteria specified in this contract notice.Any interested organisation/consortium with relevant experience may submit a Bid in response to this ITT.The Council is using the one stage procedure for admission onto the PDPSThe Light Touch PDPS will be conducted in staged Rounds. The initial Round for Lot 3 and Lot 4 for this Light Touch PDPS will close on 20/05/2022.Rounds will open and close throughout the lifetime of the PDPS at the Authorities discretion. The initial Round for Lot 3 and lot 4 for this PDPS will be open for 52 calendar days. Following on from this, each Round will be open to new or previously unsuccessful Suppliers to submit their bid. A new Round will be opened within 48 hours (excluding bank holidays and weekends) of a Round closing. Please note from time to time there may be a further delay in opening a new Round within the stated 48 hours.This means that applications can be submitted throughout the duration of the PDPS, but the Council will only process the applications as and when the round is closed. Please note the length of Rounds will vary throughout the lifetime of the PDPS.The Council intends to publish further opportunities as part of its Rounds, during the lifetime of the PDPS, relating to Children's commissioned care, accommodation and support services, for example the Provision of Supported Lodgings and the Provision of Independent Fostering Agencies (IFA) regulated by Ofsted.Further Rounds will be communicated within the tender documents at time of publication. Any changes to the procurement Timetable shall be notified to all Tenderers as soon as practicableA Supplier wanting to join the PDPS will be required to apply through the Council's procurement e-tendering portal; Fusion.Suppliers who are unsuccessful in a specific Round may apply to be admitted to the PDPS in a subsequent or later RoundThe Council will add Potential Suppliers to the PDPS throughout its duration, providing Potential Suppliers meet the requirement as outlined in the ITT and submit an Application, which is found to be compliant.Please see Additional Information in Section VI for timescale and value of the PDPS.Lot 1: Please see Additional Information in Section VI for timescale and value of the PDPS.

Title: Heavitree Court Rough Sleeping Complex Needs Project

Title: Preliminary Market Engagement: Short Breaks Targeted Support Pilot
Description: The purpose of this Preliminary Market Engagement (PME) is to share with the market North East Lincolnshire Council's (the Authority) ideas for a Targeted Short Breaks Pilot and to gather feedback on these ideas and to seek ideas about opportunities and innovation in the market. Preliminary Market Engagement (PME) allows local authorities and other contracting authorities in the public sector to engage with a market. PME is designed to encourage the commercial and voluntary sectors to engage with the development process before a procurement is released. This is the market’s opportunity to express its views, outline market developments and generally influence how solutions to the Authority’s needs might be met. There is nothing for the Authority to evaluate or select in this activity. PME is not a call for competition. Following PME, the Authority may conclude that procurement is not the best solution to meet a particular strategy outcome. The Authority may conclude that it would be better to do something entirely different to the intent within this PME. It is essential that any organisation participating in the PME understands that a procurement opportunity is not guaranteed. It is therefore essential that organisations understand that this activity is not part of a procurement exercise and involvement in the PME does not affect an organisation’s positioning either positively or negatively should a procurement opportunity arise subsequently. The Authority may release a PME to: • Share information to inform the market of an impending procurement, such that they might make preparations for the tender when it is released; and • Gather information to develop the Authority’s strategy. We therefore recommend that if there is no intent to engage in the PME, it is better to sustain interest in activity on YORtender to ensure that any interested party remains informed.

Title: CCTV Maintenance Service for Public Space, Urban Traffic Management (UTMC), Town Hall and Parking

The service areas comprise of public space, Urban Traffic Management (UTMC), Town Hall and parking. The works will comprise of reactive and preventative maintenance of all CCTV cameras across the four service areas.The operational functionality of all CCTV comprises of hardware / software support and any associated connectivity as set out in the contract document.The CCTV maintenance function for public space will operate 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. For the remaining service areas, which comprise of UTMC, Town Hall and parking , the CCTV maintenance function will operate within office hours, this is Monday to Friday 9am to 5pm, excluding bank holidays.

Description: North East Lincolnshire Council is seeking tenders for the preparation of an Activity and Interpretation Plan for a heritage project in Grimsby town centre. Due to the short timescales for the project, tenders are being sought in advance of the decision on our development phase funding application. This is to enable the successful consultant to be contracted as soon as possible after Permission to Start, if we are successful. The production of a detailed, costed activity and interpretation plan is required, which should include activity designed to enable better understanding of the architectural and social heritage of the site, as well as the audiences that we want to reach. The Plan will be submitted as part of the bid requirements for the delivery phase of the project.

Title: Repair, Replacement of Windows, Doors and associated Works
Description: STAR Housing is launching a four-to-five-year programme to repair, replace, and install windows, doors, and associated works across its housing portfolio. The initiative aims to provide safe, energy-efficient homes that meet the requirements of Awaab’s Law, the Decent Homes Standard and the government target for all properties to achieve EPC Band C by 2030. It also supports STAR Housing’s long-term net zero carbon ambitions in line with its Retrofit Strategy.To support this, the Contracting Authority seeks the replacement of windows and associated doors to approximately 3,100 homes over a four-year delivery period to the main fabric of the home. The contract is for a five year period providing programme flexibility and will incorporate specialist repairs of windows and doors operating in partnership with our in-house repairs team.The key requirements include:1. Install new, high-performance windows that meet or exceed current building regulations achieving a U-value of 0.82 W/m²K or better.2. Install new, high performance composite front doors providing tenants a modern option of four colours and four designs, with the option of composite or uPVC rear doors.3.Complete emergency repairs within 4 hours, all other day-to-day repairs within 28 days, achieving a 14 day repair completion by year two of the contract and a seven day repair by year three of the contract. Repairs should be prioritised based on individual tenant needs, even where the issue does not meet the definition of an emergency.4.Deliver all associated works, including the management of asbestos removal, replacement of soffits and fascia’s where required, making good any damage, removal of clay sills where present, provision of access and access arrangements, installation of lintels, removal and refitting of tenant blinds, and consideration of tenant-specific requirements throughout the works following a tenant centric approach

Title: Request for Information Replacement and maintenance of Site Electronic Access Systems NI Water Ltd.

The currently installed electromechanical padlock system has approximately 5500 electronic padlocks on front gates and kiosks, comprising of Grade 3, Grade 4 and Grade 5 padlocks. In addition, there are currently 3500 mechanical padlocks, 1300 electronic door cylinders/cam locks, 120 mechanical door cylinders, with 4000 electronic keys and 71 gate access systems, installed at 22 no. of sites.Any successful supplier should be able to provide services over the full geographical coverage of Northern Ireland. This will include the ongoing maintenance, repair, like for like replacement and supply of spare parts over the period of the contract. See CFT documents for a copy of the RFI.Please note this is a re-issue of the previous RFI to the market; we have provided additional information on the scope of our requirements.

Title: A  Development Agreement for the development and management of a supported living accommodation and day centre

The contract value in this notice has been based on the estimated full build cost and the Council does not anticipate paying this value.A service level agreement will be established between the Local Authority and the chosen development partner once the facility is operational for the management of the relevant services including ongoing service charges and costs. The length of the service level agreement is to be determined but is anticipated to be around a 40 year period.   The service charges and costs may be negotiated as part of the tender procedure. Title: Vegetation Clearance Around Airport Perimeter Around Doncaster Airport Perimeter
Description: Doncaster Metropolitan Borough Council (“The Council”) invite detailed proposals to carry out Vegetation Clearance Around Airport Perimeter. The Scope of Works defines the requirements for the systematic clearance of all vegetation within a 3-metre buffer zone surrounding the entire perimeter of Doncaster Sheffield Airport (DSA), encompassing both airside and landside areas to ensure unobstructed visibility and maintain compliance with operational safety and security protocols. These Services are more fully described in Section One, Part B Specification.

Title: AG3544C DAFM Provision of Badger and Foxes Necropsy Procedure and Ancillary Services
Description: The service comprises of • The collection of badger and fox carcases from designated locations countrywide and delivery to the tenderer's laboratory • Necropsy Procedure to be performed in the tenderer's laboratory • Histopathological Examination • Collection, freezing and storage of tissue samples and the transport of the tissue samples to the Central Veterinary Research Laboratory in Backweston, Co. Kildare • Safe disposal of the badger and fox carcases by rendering and disposal of other associated packaging • Reporting all findings back to the Department on a monthly and quarterly basis and then an overall annual report. Reports should be written reports, accompanied by an excel sheet and not just an excel sheet. Written reports must contain the number of badgers received, the locations the badgers were caught at, injury score assessment, pregnancy status, weight and sex of the badger, approximate age (juvenile or adult), record if gross lesions were found, record of samples harvested for culture, culture results. Reports should be sent to the Wildlife SVI and SRO in Bacteriology Lab.

Title: Contract for the Preliminary Contamination Risk Assessments
Description: Merseyside Waste Disposal Authority (MWDA) is inviting tenders from suitably qualified, experienced and registered Specialist in Land Condition (SiLC) ground investigation contractors to undertake Preliminary Contamination Risk Assessments at several of the Authority's operational waste management facilities.MWDA's long-term waste management contract, the Waste Management and Recycling Contract (WMRC), expires in 2034 and there are a number of contractual obligations required to be undertaken prior to the expiry of the Contract. This includes a determination if any ground contamination has occurred during the life of the contract.The sites that form MWDA's operational estate were leased to the WMRC Contractor upon its commencement in 2009. The Authority wishes to employ a suitably qualified and experienced contractor to determine and assess the potential for, or presence of, contamination associated with the operations carried out during the contractual term of the WMRC.The Authority wishes to undertake this work in two distinct phases. First, a desk-based study to determine if the sites are at risk of additional contamination as a result of the operations undertaken throughout the duration of the WMRC.A second intrusive phase, which will be tendered separately, will be undertaken where necessary and based on the findings of the desk study for each of the sites. This will entail the investigation, collection and analytical testing of samples as deemed necessary during the Preliminary Contamination Risk Assessment.

Title: SNBTS Clean Room Decontamination System
Description: The Scottish National Blood Transfusion Service ("SNBTS") require the purchase and installation of 1 (one) Clean Room Decontamination System within the Clean Room Suite at the Jack Copland Centre, Heriot Watt University Campus, Edinburgh.Lot 1: The Scottish National Blood Transfusion Service (SNBTS), part of NHS National Services Scotland (NHS NSS) (“Health Board”) are commencing a Procurement Exercise for 1 (one) Clean Room Decontamination System including the supply, installation, validation, training, and associated maintenance required for the operation of the units, based at the Jack Copland Centre, Edinburgh.The Scottish National Blood Transfusion Service (SNBTS) is the specialist provider of safe high-quality blood, tissues and cells products and services in Scotland. The organisation’s priority is to ensure that NHS Scotland has enough blood to meet the transfusion needs of patients in Scotland.The current Clean Room Decontamination System within SNBTS has two Bioquell Z-2 units located at JCC that are used for routine decontamination of the CRS.Bioquell Z-2 systems provide a 6-log reduction (99.9999% elimination) of bioburden from every exposed surface in a selected zone and therefore represent a key element of TCAT-GMP’s routine cleaning and sanitisation regime. This is achieved using Vapour Hydrogen Peroxide (VHP).This Tender covers the purchase and installation of 1 (one) Clean Room Decontamination System. This includes the software, training, and equipment and associated maintenance required for their operation.The supplier shall act as the Principal Contractor and shall be responsible for the supply, installation and commissioning of the replacement system andassociated equipment.

Title: Community and School Aged Immunisation Service (CSAIS) in Birmingham and Solihull
Description: NHS Arden and Greater East Midlands Commissioning Support Unit (AGCSU) on behalf of NHS England Midlands (The Commissioner) would like to notify the market of an opportunity to provide a Community and School Aged Immunisation Service (CSAIS) in Birmingham and Solihull. <br/><br/>The service commencement date is 1 September 2026. The contract will be for an initial five-year term with the option to extend for a further two years under a NHS Standard Contract. The contract value is estimated to total £12.7m (including extensions) and a cost uplift factors (CUF) will apply from year one.<br/><br/>Please note, the deadline for responses to the Competitive Process is 12:00PM (Mid-day) on 12th December 2025.Lot 1: The current School Aged Immunisation Service contract expires on 31 August 2026. The service shall follow a national service specification. All details, including the specification has been made available as part of the procurement document suite on the Atamis portal.<br/><br/>School Aged Immunisation Services are required to be delivered predominantly in a school setting and currently covers;<br/>• Human Papillomavirus (HPV)vaccinations<br/>• Diphtheria, Tetanus and Poliomyelitis(Td/IPV) booster<br/>• Meningococcal ACWY (MenACWY) conjugate vaccine<br/>• Measles, Mumps and Rubella (MMR) catch up vaccinations<br/>• School-aged children’s Seasonal Influenza vaccinations<br/><br/>The provider will also deliver a catch-up service for children and young people with any of the above missing vaccinations. It is important to note that vaccination schedules can change and evolve in the light of emerging best practice and scientific evidence and as such additional services may be added during the lifetime of the contract to best deliver the needs of the overall service. The Provider is required to reflect these changes accordingly in a timely way with agreement from the Commissioner. These vaccines form part of the national routine childhood vaccination programme, which aims to prevent school-aged children from developing vaccine preventable childhood diseases that are associated with significant mortality and morbidity. High uptake of vaccinations in this population also helps to protect the wider community through herd immunity.<br/><br/>The provider will also be required to offer a selective neonatal Hepatitis B domiciliary service to deliver Hepatitis B & MMR vaccinations (2nd & 6th) in a home setting, along with a Dried Blood Spot Test for HBsAG to babies born to Hepatitis B Positive mothers registered in Birmingham and Solihull.<br/><br/>The Commissioner expects the Community and School Aged Immunisation Service to be delivered primarily in schools with additional arrangements in place to vaccinate those service users who are not in mainstream education and those with an unknown school and domiciliary services. The Provider must offer the Service to 100% of eligible school-aged children and young people.<br/><br/>Please note the deadline for submissions is 12:00PM(Mid-day) on the 12th December 2025.

Title: CWC25171MW - Provision of Kerbside Recycling Processing
Description: Wolverhampton is a city with a population of 600,000 residents and circa 108,000 households. CWC operate two Household Waste and Recycling Centres with 15,000-20,000 visits to each site per month and a commercial waste collection service. We currently collect a single steam fully co-mingled dry mixed recyclables in one bin as a fortnightly collection or more regularly for communal properties and commercial customers. We collected over 21,000 tonnes in 2024/2025 that was taken to our transfer station that is centrally located in Wolverhampton (WV1). The station operates Monday to Friday from 0600 to 1500 to ensure that a minimum of 80 tonnes of the collected recyclables is loaded into walking floors to reach the contracted materials recycling facility. This market exercise is focussing on the options available within the market for the haulage and disposal options of the Dry Mixed Recycling collected by the service, and to gain an understanding of the market that is available, along with any information that will help and influence the service design prior to developing a haulage and disposal specification that will support the service. We are particularly interested in any innovation to maximise recycling rates, provide service resilience and flexibility to respond to the demands of simpler recycling.Keywords:Kerbside, Processing, Recyling, Waste

Title: Supply, Delivery and Installation of a Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM) Suite consisting of 2 TEM tools and 1 Focused Ion Beam–Scanning Electron Microscope (FIB.SEM) for Tyndall Instit, UCC,
Description: Tenders are sought for the Supply, Delivery and Installation of a Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM) Suite, to Tyndall National Institute, University College Cork (UCC) comprising three complementary instruments: 1. One (1) Aberration-corrected and monochromated TEM 2. One (1) 200 kV high-throughput TEM 3. One (1) Focused Ion Beam–Scanning Electron Microscope (FIB-SEM) This procurement will establish a nationally significant microscopy capability for Ireland, strengthening Tyndall’s leadership in semiconductor, photonic, and quantum materials research and supporting long-term collaboration with academic and industrial stakeholders. The TEM Suite will deliver sustained scientific, technological, and economic impact through enhanced analytical capability, research excellence, and innovation at the nanoscale. This investment will expand and modernise Tyndall’s capability in advanced materials and device characterisation to meet the requirements of its national and international research programmes, including activities under the EU Chips Act and strategic collaborations with academic and industrial partners. The TEM Suite will form a key component of the new Tyndall laboratory facilities currently under development and will support Tyndall’s mission to provide world-leading infrastructure for semiconductor, photonic, and quantum technologies. The Aberration-corrected and monochromated TEM will represent the highest-performance instrument within the suite. It must deliver sub-ångström imaging resolution and high-energy-resolution spectroscopy, providing the capability to study interfaces, defects, and nanostructures at the atomic scale. The system must support advanced analytical and imaging modes, including low-dose operation for beam-sensitive materials, Lorentz and 4D-STEM imaging, and in-situ experimentation (electrical, thermal, and environmental). Automated alignment, optical stability, and full integration with advanced camera, detector, and control software are essential to ensure repeatable and high-quality data generation across multiple users. The 200 kV high-throughput TEM capable of atomic resolution imaging will provide a complementary, multi-user analytical capability to support daily research operations and routine analysis. It must combine high brightness and excellent spatial resolution with rapid operational stability, user-friendly alignment, and automated workflow functionality. This instrument will be optimised for versatility and efficiency, ensuring broad accessibility for internal and collaborative research, training, and industry engagement activities. The FIB-SEM will enable site-specific sample preparation, 3D structural analysis, and nanoscale milling to support both TEM systems. It must achieve high-resolution imaging and precision ion-beam milling for lamella production and cross-sectional analysis. Integration with the TEM workflows is required to ensure seamless specimen transfer and preparation from wafer-scale structures to atomic-scale analysis. This tender is being issued as a single integrated suite rather than as separate tools to ensure technical, operational, and economic coherence across all instruments. Procuring the TEMs and FIB-SEM from a single manufacturer will enable a shared control software platform, providing a consistent user interface and operational framework across the suite. This is important in Tyndall’s multi-user research and training environment, for staff, postgraduate students, and industry partners, as it simplifies training, improves safety, and promotes efficient use of laboratory time. A unified suite will also allow for the interchange of sample holders and accessories, enabling seamless workflow integration from sample preparation to atomic-scale imaging. A single-supplier arrangement provides additional benefits including simplified warranty and maintenance agreements, harmonised service schedules, and a single point of technical contact.

Title: Supported Accommodation for Homeless, Complex Single People 24/7 high level support (pathway from Temporary accommodation / Hostel Provision)
Description: This Tender includes two contracts (Lots) to provide a supported accommodation scheme to single people who are:• 18+• Who have been assessed as homeless• Have been assessed as having a variety of support needs through the supported accommodation eligibility assessment and panel process.The project will accommodate single people, both male and female, and provide flexible housing related support to help individuals to live independently and move onto suitable, affordable alternative housing. This alternative housing may include, private rented accommodation (including shared properties), social housing or in some cases moving in with family and friends. If appropriate, this may also include recommendation for a placement in alternative supported accommodation or a care setting.The project will be staffed 24 hours a day and all clients will be supported to comply with the terms and conditions and house rules, which include a requirement to engage with the provision of support.AIMS AND OBJECTIVES• To prepare individuals with the necessary skills to transition successfully into independent living. • To support individuals to live independently and move onto alternative, affordable long-term housing. This alterative housing may include shared properties, private rented accommodation, social housing etc.• To assist clients with their presenting support needs, offering a harm reduction approach and ensuring referrals to relevant agencies are made to meet medical and physical needs (e.g., Specialist Health Team).• To provide all residents with support to help identify their needs, expectations, and aspirations. • To provide a range of planned activities that are designed to help clients develop their personal skills to live independently and to secure and manage a home. • To provide support that is person centred, taking into account their personal needs, interests, and individual goals. • To work in partnership with Housing, Substance Misuse providers, Health provision, Adult Social Care, training, employment agencies and Criminal Justice Services to deliver holistic support packages. • To ensure clients are referred and supported by the agencies that can most effectively and appropriately meet their needs.Lotting Structure:Lot 1 - Abertonllwyd House (Treherbert)Lot 2 - Martins Close (Abercynon)Bidders can bid for one or both Lots. Bidders can be successful for both.

Title: Surveillance Systems DSA
Description: Doncaster Sheffield Airport (DSA) is seeking a contract for the following options: Surveillance Sensors only • A Primary Surveillance Radar (PSR) with co-mounted Mode S Secondary Surveillance Radar (SSR) (Lot 1) or. • A PSR with Wide Area Multilateration (WAM) System providing the Secondary Surveillance data (Lot 2) and; ATC Display Equipment only • A Surveillance Data Processing and Display System (SDPDS) (Lot 3) Complete Surveillance System • A Surveillance System comprising of the Sensors and Display System (Lot 4 and 5) Services • The design, supply, installation, testing & commissioning of the Surveillance System including the SDPDS. • Verification evidence required by the ANSP or CAA • Qualified and competent staff for the implementation of the Surveillance System: Sensors and Display at the Airport. • On-site training Air Traffic Control (ATC) staff prior to Site Acceptance Testing of the SDPDS. • On-site training Air Traffic Safety Electronic Personnel (ATSEP) prior to the Factory Acceptance Testing and Site Acceptance Testing. • Project management, supervision, labour, materials, plant, equipment, machinery, transport, accommodation, welfare and all other items necessary to complete the project work within their scope. • As a minimum Maintenance Support for the System Design Life of 15 years Tenderers may submit tenders for Lot 1 and/or Lot 2 and Lot 3 and the combination Lots 4 and 5. Title: Home Support Service
Description: Tenders are invited by the Council from Suppliers with relevant experience and ability to demonstrate sufficient capacity for the provision of Home Care Support (Domiciliary) (the “Services”) under a proposed multiple Supplier Light Touch Framework.  The Home Support Service in Kirklees will provide care and support to adults aged 18 and over living at home in the community, who have been assessed to meet the Council's eligibility criteria.  This includes (but is not limited to) adults who have assessed care and support needs associated with older age, sensory impairment, dementia, learning disability, physical ill health, disrupted lifestyle patterns, substance misuse and mental illness. The Service Provider must be registered with the Care Quality Commission (CQC) and deliver services in accordance with the registration requirements of the CQC, complying with all relevant regulations and best practice guidelines.  The anticipated commencement date for the Framework is 22nd June 2026. The anticipated expiry date for the Framework is 21st June 2029, with the option to extend for a further two (2) periods of three (3) years each.   The Council reserve the right to reopen/ refresh the Framework over its lifetime.  The estimated value of the Framework is approximately £27,000,000  Framework annual value. Total value including extensions £243,000,000

Title: Strategic Workplace Planning & Target Operating Model
Description: SC is issuing this Invitation to Tender (ITT) to appoint a supplier to conduct an organisational review. The purpose of this review is to define the optimal structure that will enable SC to achieve its strategic objectives and support sustainable growth, thereby reducing its dependency on grant-in-aid funding. The primary focus will be to conduct a strategic workforce analysis and develop a robust workforce plan alongside evaluating and recommending the most effective organisational structure and target operating model. However, should additional workstreams be identified during the initial review, SC reserves the right to request the supplier to provide costings for these under the scope of this contract.Lot 1: SC is issuing this Invitation to Tender (ITT) to appoint a supplier to conduct an organisational review. Title: Development of a new Sport Wales Website

The new website will be built using an open-source Content Management System (CMS), with the supplier responsible for configuring and developing all templates, components, and content structures required to deliver the final site. The supplier’s role is to bring our existing work and designs to life through high-quality front-end development, robust CMS configuration, and a seamless bilingual content experience that works flawlessly across all devices and screen sizes.

Title: Extra Care Housing/ Adult Social Care
Description: This project focuses on the development and commissioning of a high-quality Extra Care Housing service within Blackburn with Darwen, designed to support adults with varying levels of need to live independently within their own homes. The specification outlines the delivery of 24/7 on-site care and support across five schemes, with an emphasis on prevention, wellbeing, and community integration. Lot 1 covers two Extra Care Housing schemes based in Blackburn: Kingsway and Springbank Court. Both cater primarily to residents aged 55 and over, offering 24-hour on-site care and support. Lot 2 includes three schemes: Albion Mill (Ewood), Riverside Heights, and Pembroke Court (Darwen). These schemes support a wider age range, from 18 years and over, providing 24-hour or daytime on-site care depending on the location. They offer tailored support for residents with diverse needs, including long-term health conditions, dementia, and physical disabilities.

Title: Southampton Adults Alcohol & Drug Support Service
Description: Southampton City Council ("the Council") invites Tenders from suitably qualified service providers ("Potential Suppliers") for the provision of Southampton Adults Alcohol & Drug Support Service. This Procurement is being conducted in accordance with the Health Care Services (Provider Selection Regime) Regulations 2023 using the Competitive Procedure. The contract being procured is for the delivery of drug and alcohol treatment and support services. The successful supplier will deliver a full range of evidence-based interventions including harm reduction, psychosocial support, and multi-agency coordination, with pharmacological interventions provided under clinical governance. The services will operate within a recovery-oriented framework and will be person-centred, trauma-informed, and accessible to all residents of the city, including those with complex needs and those not yet ready to change their substance use. The term of the contract shall be 1st July 2026 until 30th June 2030 (i.e. 4 years) with the option to extend for up to a further period of 2 years (i.e. until 30th June 2032) at the sole discretion of the Council. The estimated contract value range is from £30,328,092 to £64,122,145 for the term of contract plus extension period. Explanation of this contract value range is provided in the procurement documentation.  Suppliers interested in bidding should register with Proactis at: https://supplierlive.proactisp2p.com/Account/Login and search for the project using reference number SPR/1000755 or RFX/1000435 or REQ/1000435. The closing date for the submission of tenders is 12 noon, Thursday 11th December 2025.Lot 1: See II.1.4. Short description above. Title: Clinical Engineering Service - Medical Devices
Description: We are tendering for a clinical engineer service to support our management of medical devices across Oxford Health NHS Foundation Trust (OHFT). The contract will start from 1st April 2026 and initially run for 3 years with the option for OHFT to extend by a maximum of a further 2 years (5 years in total) with breaks in contract available at the end of year 3 and year 4. We will ask the new company to work with the incumbent company to manage a smooth transition and to start mobilisation prior to the start of the contract.The key components of the contract include managing our master asset list, preparing new devices for use in services, servicing all medical devices at least annually in line with warranties and manufacturing requirements, responding to issues with devices from clinical teams and completing repairs with devices. As well as providing OHFT with advice as requested, which will include support with identifying new devices/models, input into clinical evaluations and an annual age/condition analysis of all devices in August of each year to support life cycle planning.Additional information: To express interest and participate in the tender, please register and apply via Atamis e-sourcing portal https://health-family.force.com/s/Welcome.Should Tenderers have any queries, or having problems using the portal, they should contact Helpdesk at:Phone: 0800 9956035E-mail: support-health@atamis.co.uk

Title: National Trust-NI-Lough Neagh: A Roadmap to Recovery
Description: The National Trust, on behalf of collaborators involved in the Forever Lough Neagh initiative, are requesting proposals for a Consultant led Multidisciplinary Team to develop a holistic, comprehensive and long - term strategic framework for Lough Neagh:  A Roadmap to Recovery . The Trust seeks to appoint a Multidisciplinary Consultant to undertake a strategy development process with the aim of bringing together learning from previous activities, and initiatives and projects already underway, to identify gaps in knowledge and identify actions and clear recommendations for the future. A 12-month term (1 calendar year, anticipated to commence in April 2026) will be available to complete the commission.We are keen to work with consultants and sub-consultants that are invested in the outcomes of this project, aiming to work together to develop recommendations that will lead to a more sustainable future for Lough Neagh.  We would welcome different types of organisations and groups to come together as consortium partners to form a multi-disciplinary team to deliver this commission. We recognise the importance of local and lived knowledge and experience, and we encourage potential lead Consultants to carefully consider how teams are put together to allow for open opportunities.The Trust seeks initial information from a range of bidders as to possible solutions, capacity, capability and relevant experience, with a view to forming a select list for a later Request for Proposal process. Title: Tender for Upgrades to the Male and Female Bathrooms at SmartPly Europe DAC ‘25
Description: SMARTPLY Europe DAC is looking for suitably qualified companies to upgrade both the male and female bathrooms located at our site in Belview Slieverue Waterford X91 PX75. The bathrooms are adjacent to the canteen, just off the main entrance in the SmartPly building. The project is to enhance the outdated bathroom facilities and replace the poorly functioning existing services. Civil/Structural Scope of Works The main contractor is responsible for coordination of mechanical and electrical strip out including removal and correct means of disposal of all equipment and material from strip out works. The Main contractor to remove and strip out existing furniture, flooring and ceiling. Temporary access door to canteen from office block - with weather cover The main contractor is responsible for coordinating mechanical and electrical services installation as part of project schedule. Main contractor responsible for supply and installation of all items shown on the CSA Drawings and Documents Electrical Scope of Works This document sets out the basis requirements for the strip out, supply, installation, testing and commissioning of the Electrical Systems at the Smartply Toilet upgrade project. The Electrical Contractor shall supply, install, test + commission all equipment as specified and/or indicated on the drawings and outlined in the electrical specification. Contractor responsible for strip out + isolation electrical services: • Isolate smoke heads while keeping loop in operation. • Strip out of general services • Strip out of lighting • Electrical wiring associated with Mechanical ventilation system o Ventilation cw supply and return air fan – with pressure control Contractor responsible for installation testing and commissioning of electrical services: • Installation of required containment • Installation of new smoke heads and commissioning • Installation and associated wiring of light new fittings PIR controlled • Emergency lighting • Installation of general services • Wring of mechanical ventilation system ( PIR and timeclock controlled) • Wiring of automatic urinal flushing system. • Bonding of all equipment • Comply with building program requirements. • Provision of accurate O+M manuals and “As Installed” drawings. Mechanical Scope of Works: The scope of this contract consists of the supply, delivery, installation, testing and commissioning of the complete mechanical services installation for the areas as outlined above, as shown on the tender drawings, and as specified in these documents. The general extent of Mechanical Services Installation is as follows: • Strip out of all existing mechanical services including isolation and disconnection while not distribution services to adjacent rooms Bonding of all equipment. ( water, ventilation, above ground drainage, removal of sanitary wear, disposal by main contractor • New water services throughout the bathroom with pipe work to be upgraded inside the toilets envelope • Above ground drainage to be replaced and all pipe work to be hidden behind integrated plumbing solution panelling (IPS) • Installation of a new ventilation system that has air intake and extract louvres though building façade on the 1st floor. Consisting of a new HRU to be located in the 1st floor storeroom. • Replace radiators and replace pipe work as necessary • Duct work to be inspected and if deemed adequate to remain. • Co-ordination with other trades and main contractor. • Comply with building program + phasing requirements. • Testing, commissioning, proving, demonstrating and handover of installation. • Provision of accurate O+M manuals and “As Installed” drawings **Please see the tender document and additional specification documents attached**

Title: Update of Regulatory Impact Assessment – Workplace Recycling Laws
Description: This procurement is taking place under WRAP's Internal Framework FRA080: Materials Systems Transformation.Phase one of the Workplace Recycling Law came into force on 6 April 2024 in Wales, with phase 2 due to come into force in April 2026.  Welsh Government is now seeking to understand the impacts of adding further materials to the list of those to be presented separately for collection and recycling.Welsh Government wishes to assess the impact of the proposed phase 3 of the Regulations which includes the impact of separating plastic film and textiles.The original RIA was conducted in 2019 (commissioned by WG) and was then revised and published in 2023 in readiness for introduction of phase 1 of the Workplace Recycling Regs.  A further RIA was carried out in in July 2025 for the inclusion of sWEEE (phase 2). The policy decision to add plastic film to the list of materials to be presented separately for collection and recycling was made on the basis of the 4 nations Government Response to the 2021 pEPR consultation published 26 March 2022 (EPR Consultation Government response template) and accompanying Impact Assessment which included consideration of the plastic film requirement and is available here: Impact Assessment.  The successful bidder will need to carry out an RIA assessing the inclusion of plastic film and textiles. The baseline for this analysis should include phases 1 and 2 of the Workplace Recycling Regs.The Welsh Government wishes to understand the impact of each of the proposed additions (i.e. plastic film and textiles) to the specified material streams to be separately collected.To view this notice, please click here: https://www.delta-esourcing.com/delta/viewNotice.html?noticeId=994379821

Title: Call for Tenders for the provision of catering services to Limerick Education Support Centre
Description: Limerick Education Support Centre is seeking competitive proposals from suitably qualified businesses to supply and serve a range of hot and cold food to Limerick Education Support Centre commencing on December 1st 2025. Hot and cold food either to be prepared and served onsite at Limerick Education Support Centre or prepared offsite, delivered and served at a time specified by LESC. The nature of the business in Limerick Education Support Centre is dynamic and fluid. This has an impact upon the level of catering required on a day-to-day basis. There are occasions and time-periods throughout the year when the requirement for catering services is very high and other periods where this is low or zero. The high demand coincides mainly with days that schools are operational. Examples of low or zero time-periods include, but are not limited to; school holidays, public holidays and other ‘quiet periods’ in the run-in to school holidays. This fluidity and movement in demand for catering services is an integral part of the tender. It is important to note that Limerick Education Support Centre will not pay for such periods of diminished, low activity or in-activity and no compensation for such inactivity is available. The successful tenderer will receive as much notice as is reasonably possible prior to such periods of diminished, low or in-activity. Title: Network Rail - Wales and Western - Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Installation
Description: Network Rail is seeking to install a mix of permanent and temporary Electric Vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure across 45 sites in the Wales and Western Region. Charger capacities will range from 22 kW to 150 kW, with the number of chargers per site varying between 2 and 30 depending on site-specific needs. The scope covers the full end-to-end delivery of these works, including site assessments, design, procurement of chargers, installation (including any required electrical upgrades and civil works), testing and commissioning, and handover with training for site personnel. The aim is to provide reliable, safe, and efficient charging solutions that meet all relevant standards, integrate with existing infrastructure, and can accommodate varying charging demands. The project is expected to be completed within a six-month period, with timelines and budgets informed by detailed site assessments. Suppliers’ input through this engagement will help shape the procurement approach, technical specifications, delivery programme, and commercial model.

Title: TENDER TO PROVIDE SPORT AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY SESSIONS
Description: Fermanagh and Omagh District Council (FODC) from time to time may seek external sport and physical activity providers to help deliver activity sessions in the Council district at various Council and Community facilities. A panel of service providers will be awarded for each lot. A service provider may bid for any or all the lots in either the Fermanagh area or the Omagh area or both. Suppliers will be ranked in order beginning with the lowest price per lot (based on the average cost per participant). It is up to the provider to consider coaching ratios set by the relevant National Governing Body when they are entering a price per activity. The following Lots are to be awarded: Traditional Target Archery; Soft Archery; Athletics Track and Field; Badminton; Boccia; Bowls; Boxing; Boxercise; Chair Based Exercise; Chi Me; Cricket; Couch to 5K (LIRF); Cycle Instructor; Dance; Gymnastics; Hockey; Netball; New Age Kurling; Pilates; Rugby; Tennis; Volleyball; Wrestling; Angling (Coarse); Angling (Game); Canoeing (Canadian type); Kayaking (sit on tops or traditional); Open Water Swimming; Stand up Paddle Boarding; Rowing; sailing; Disability Sailing; Walk Leader; Hillwalking and Rambling; Leave No Trace; Orienteering; Bush Craft; Triathlon and Mountain Biking. In developing a panel, the Council reserves the right to work with other groups or clubs if there is a sports or community development outcome to be realised and where it is beneficial to make local connections for sports development and sustainability.

Title: Provision of a Managing Agent to Deliver the Home and Energy Efficient Scotland : Area Based Scheme in Orkney
Description: Orkney Islands Council has a requirement to appoint a suitably qualified managing agent to deliver the Home Energy Efficient Scheme : Area Based Scheme in Orkney.Lot 1: The requirement relates to the appointment of a suitably qualified managing agent to deliver the HEES : ABS into households in communities across Orkney. It is envisaged that the contract will comprise of the marketing and recruitment of participants, appointing suitably qualified retrofit professionals (as per PAS2035:2023 definitions) procuring, appointing and managing sub-contractors/ retrofit installers, sourcing and providing relevant data required to meet reporting obligation outlined by the Scottish Government HEES : ABS guidance.The Council is looking to bid for a minimum of 1.5M GBP per year through the Scottish Government HEES : ABS programme.  This is also the expectation that the winning tenderer will access additional funding from external sources over the five-year period of the contract.  This will primarily come from ECO and the Council will consider an ECO Flexible Eligibility Statement of Intent to support the HEES : ABS programme. Additional information: The contract value of 975000 GBP is based on an estimated bid for HEES : ABS funding of 7.5 Million over the 5 year contract duration including the 2 x 12 month extensions at 195000 GBP available annually for the managing agent fee.

Title: RFT for the Provision of Electrical Services Framework at SmartPly Europe DAC'25
Description: Smartply Europe DAC are seeking tender submissions from suitably qualified electrical companies with extensive experience in the OSB / wood processing industry for appointment to a Framework Agreement for a range of small to medium sized Electrical works at their plant in Bellview, Slieverue, Waterford, X91 PX75. All electrical contractors must have the following:- Please confirm 1) Safe electric registered. 2) Competence in RCD testing + Earth fault loop impedance testing 3) Qualified in Portable appliance testing. 4) Compliant with all aspects of I.S.10101:2020 Types of works: 1) Annual Large-scale shutdown works 2) Fortnightly shutdown works 3) Hourly rate works related to projects 4) Works are limited to all voltages below 1,000 vac and 1,500 vdc An example of the type of work involved is listed but not limited to the table below. The scope is designed to be comprehensive to cover potential future needs. For individual tasks, suppliers are only expected to perform the parts relevant to them. No. Electrical Activity Performance Characteristics 2. Routine Maintenance General basic electrical maintenance, services to electrical plant + equipment. Generally, these are the activities scheduled on a time-based schedule derived from preventive or predictive maintenance strategies. Some examples are visual inspections, cleaning, functional tests, calibration and measurement of operating quantities. 1. Visual Inspections Inspection should look for: Evidence of damage caused by dirt, loose parts, or foreign objects. Verification that air inlets are not blocked. Evidence of moisture and/or dirt build-up Unusual noises, leaking oil seals, or high vibration. Oil level gages (if present) should be checked. Evidence of degradation of foundation, bed plates, anchor bolts Evidence of oil rings turning (if applicable) Evidence of leaking oil and water piping and connections 2. Temperature monitoring of bearings and windings If motor is not equipped with installed sensors: record bearing temperatures and stator temperature using thermo graphic imaging. This data should be trended. The monitoring should be completed at similar motor loading and ambient temperature to allow for accurate trending. 3. Running Current Record and trend all three phase currents and verify the currents are balanced and do not exceed nameplate rating. Each phase should be within +/- 5 per cent of the average of all three phases 4. Cabling / Re-wiring Pulling cabling in to place and wiring according to specification outlined. 5. Insulation resistance (IR) Perform IR check between motor leads and ground. This determines condition of the ground insulation. Record, temperature correct and trend 6. Winding Resistance A comparison of the line-to-line resistances of the motor’s winding. This test should be done at the motor terminals using a meter capable of measuring low resistance (milliohms). A typical ohm meter does not have adequate accuracy. Record, temperate correct and trend. Each phase should be within +/- (3 - 5 per cent) of the average of all three phases

Title: PQQ for MDF Blowline Upgrades at Medite Europe DAC
Description: MEDITE Europe DAC is invites expressions of interest from experience / qualified companies for the supply of Blowline resin injection and steam recovery systems for a Medium Density Fibre production line that operates up to 15 t/h of dry fibre and 20 to 70 l/min of resin. For Blowline resin injection technology a system will be required to control and modulate the correct application of resin based on specific product requirements within the above flows in order to ensure efficient use of resin while maintaining product quality and without negative impacts to the process or product itself. This efficient use of resin with the new system should result in a resin usage saving. A system that can also apply the other additives typically added in the Blowline in the MDF process such as dye, urea, wax and hardener would be desirable. The system should be fully automated. For Blowline steam recovery technology a system will be required to recover steam from the Blowline and return it for reuse on the refining system. The returned/recovered steam should have minimal wood/fibre content and not cause blocking of the Blowline or other parts of the refining system. The equipment must be a proven technology and conform to best practice design principles and all relevant European legislation including CE marking. It is anticipated that order placement will occur in Q1 2026 with project completion by Q3 2026.

Title: TD2327 - Driver Training and Assessments
Description: Derby City Council (The Council) is undertaking this procurement to establish a contract for the provision of driver training and assessments.  This will include professional LGV/HGV training (Category C and C + E) training and driving assessments of all drivers prior to using the DCC fleet to ensure their roadworthiness to drive the type of vehicle required as part of their role at the Council.  There will also be the need for CPC (Certificate of Professional Competence) training, and specific driver related training as and when required.  The initial contract period is 3 years; the contract is estimated to commence 1 March 2026 and expire 28 February 2029.  There will be an option to extend the contract for 2 years in annual increments, subject to satisfactory performance, business needs and mutual agreement. Maximum contract period is 5 years. Prices shall be fixed for the first 12 months from the commencement date; thereafter any increment shall be once per year.  Any increase will need to be submitted in writing with a clear demonstration detailing the reasoning for the price increase.  Any price increase must not exceed the Consumer Price Index (CPI), and price increase will not be implemented until agreement from the Council.  For this contract, Derby City Council expects that the following changes may take placeduring the contract term:•Change in vehicle make or model - The Council may need to switch to different types or brands of vehicles during the contract.•Fleet size changes - The number of vehicles required may increase, which could affect the overall contract cost.oThe Council anticipate that due to the creation of the East Midlands Combined County Authority (EMCCA) there may result in changed to the council structures and service delivery For this contract it is anticipated that the effects of EMCCA may lead to an increased Fleet size and structure.•Change in service areas - The geographical area may change, particularly if there are updates due to Local Government Reorganisation (LGR).oLocal Government Reorganisation (LGR) is underway in several areas across the country and may result in changes to council structures, service delivery and responsibilities, and geographical coverage during the life of the contract. For this contractit is anticipated that the effects of LGR may lead to an increased Fleet size and structure.o The core contract value, estimated at £448,000.00, based on known current service RequirementsoAn additional estimated value of £224,000.00 to reflect potential future changes in service scope or volume linked to LGR / EMCCA. It is unknown at this stage how this value will be split.These are not guaranteed changes but are to provide early notice to ensure they can be factored into your planning.

Title: Multi Criteria Decision Analysis Stage 2 – Adaptation of historic buildings and structures to coastal erosion - UID 132
Description: This project seeks to build on research undertaken by Historic England and others, to establish an effective technical framework for historic built assets excluding archaeological remains, landscapes and wrecks.  It will offer solutions and identify opportunities for the heritage sector when considering the impact planning policy and climate change impacts have on approaches to specific historic buildings and structures. This project also seeks to support those working in the heritage sector to assess and analyse decisions for change, whilst considering the economic and carbon [variable] impacts these choices may have. Multi criteria decision analysis (MCDA) is a recognised methodology used within wider government to help decision-makers rationally choose between multiple options where there are several conflicting objectives.For more detailed information please see the attached Invitation to Tender.

Title: End User Workspace & Hosting
Description: In April 2021, Reading Borough Council transitioned to the 'ICT Future Operating Model' (FOM), with 3 external providers delivering 4 'towers' of services, managed and supported by an in-house team. Since then, we have been on a journey to delivering a reliable and robust service, which has been consistently reflected in strong staff satisfaction scores.Our aim is to take this satisfaction to the next level in the Next Generation Operating Model, that increases customer satisfaction, service reliability and interoperability with associated applications.1. Our End User Workspace (EUW) & Hosting contract provides services to 2,400 users, located across 66 sites as well as remote workers. This service is responsible for the management of 10 ITIL processes, namely: Service Desk, Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management, Configuration Management, Service Level Management, Event Management, Availability Management, Capacity Management, Release & Deployment. The organisation has invested significantly in streamlining ticket handling, adopting a shift-left approach and driving demand through our ITSM tool, ServiceNow.Suppliers are encouraged to propose solutions that support this strategic direction, including: - A phased implementation plan to minimize service disruption - Integration with existing systems and services - Enhanced security, visibility, and control across the network Supplier Engagement The Council welcomes innovative proposals that: - Aligning with modern networking standards and security frameworks - Demonstrate scalability, resilience, and cost-effectiveness - Support the Council's digital transformation and sustainability goals

Title: WA/2025/08 - Sliabh Liag Mater Plan
Description: The purpose of this tender is to appoint a supplier to develop a 10-year tourism? masterplan for Sliabh Liag, setting out a clear, innovative, and sustainable vision for the site. The plan will maximise Sliabh Liag’s potential as a world-class visitor destination while ensuring the protection of its unique natural environment and the delivery of social and economic benefits for local communities. Sliabh Liag is a Signature Discovery Point on the Wild Atlantic Way, Ireland’s iconic coastal touring route. The master plan must align with the brand proposition and visitor experience principles of the Wild Atlantic Way, recognising the site's strategic importance within the network. The plan should strengthen Sliabh Liag’s role across the wider Wild Atlantic Way, ensuring consistency in storytelling, design language, and visitor experience. In addition, Sliabh Liag is a key site featured in the West Donegal and the Islands Destination Experience Development Plan, a five-year sustainable destination strategy being rolled out by Fáilte Ireland, commencing in 2026. The masterplan must complement and support the objectives of this regional development framework, contributing to the creation of a cohesive and compelling visitor experience that enhances the sites appeal while promoting long-term sustainability for the region. The outcome will be a practical, costed, and deliverable roadmap that balances conservation with development and positions Sliabh Liag for long-term success.

Title: Coach Hire for Student Open Days
Description: The University of Exeter hosts a series of Open Days each year to allow prospective students and their guests to visit the campus, meet staff and students, and experience university life. These events are a key part of the University’s student recruitment activities and attract large numbers of visitors from across the UK.
